query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
1 Poscia che l’accoglienze oneste e liete 2 furo iterate tre e quattro volte, 3 Sordel si trasse, e disse: «Voi, chi siete?».
query.result: 1 After the honest and happy greetings 2 were repeated three and four times, 3 Sordel stepped forward and said: "Who are you?".

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
4 «Anzi che a questo monte fosser volte 5 l’anime degne di salire a Dio, 6 fur l’ossa mie per Ottavian sepolte.
query.result: 4 "Before the souls worthy of ascending to God 5 were turned to this mountain, 6 my bones were buried by Octavian.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
7 Io son Virgilio; e per null’ altro rio 8 lo ciel perdei che per non aver fé». 9 Così rispuose allora il duca mio.
query.result: 7 I am Virgil; and for no other sin 8 did I lose heaven than for not having faith". 9 Thus replied then my leader.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
10 Qual è colui che cosa innanzi sé 11 sùbita vede ond’ e’ si maraviglia, 12 che crede e non, dicendo «Ella è . . . non è . . . »,
13 tal parve quelli; e poi chinò le ciglia, 14 e umilmente ritornò ver’ lui, 15 e abbracciòl là ’ve ’l minor s’appiglia.
query.result:
10 Such is he who suddenly sees something before him 11 that he marvels at, 12 who believes and does not, saying "It is . . . it is not . . . ",
13 such he appeared; and then he lowered his gaze, 14 and humbly returned towards him, 15 and embraced him where the lesser one clings.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
16 «O gloria di Latin», disse, «per cui 17 mostrò ciò che potea la lingua nostra, 18 o pregio etterno del loco ond’ io fui,
19 qual merito o qual grazia mi ti mostra? 20 S’io son d’udir le tue parole degno, 21 dimmi se vien d’inferno, e di qual chiostra».
query.result:
16 "O glory of the Latin tongue," he said, "through whom 17 it was shown what our language could do, 18 O eternal honor of the place from which I came,
19 what merit or what grace shows you to me? 20 If I am worthy to hear your words, 21 tell me if you come from hell, and from which circle."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
22 «Per tutt’ i cerchi del dolente regno», 23 rispuose lui, «son io di qua venuto; 24 virtù del ciel mi mosse, e con lei vegno.

Please translate literally into English.
25 Non per far, ma per non fare ho perduto 26 a veder l’alto Sol che tu disiri 27 e che fu tardi per me conosciuto.
query.result: 25 Not for doing, but for not doing, have I lost 26 the chance to see the high Sun that you desire, 27 and that was recognized by me too late.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
28 Luogo è là giù non tristo di martìri, 29 ma di tenebre solo, ove i lamenti 30 non suonan come guai, ma son sospiri.
query.result: 28 There is a place down there, not sad with torments, 29 but of darkness only, where the lamentations 30 do not sound like wails, but are sighs.

31 Here I stand with the innocent children 32 bitten by the teeth of death before 33 they were freed from original sin;
34 here I stand with those who did not clothe themselves with the three holy 35 virtues, and without vice 36 knew the others and followed all of them.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
37 Ma se tu sai e puoi, alcuno indizio 38 dà noi per che venir possiam più tosto 39 là dove purgatorio ha dritto inizio».
query.result: 37 But if you know and are able, give us some indication 38 so that we can come more quickly 39 to where Purgatory rightly begins."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
43 Ma vedi già come dichina il giorno, 44 e andar sù di notte non si puote; 45 però è buon pensar di bel soggiorno.

Please translate literally into English.
46 Anime sono a destra qua remote; 47 se mi consenti, io ti merrò ad esse, 48 e non sanza diletto ti fier note».

Please translate literally into English.
49 «Com’ è ciò?», fu risposto. «Chi volesse 50 salir di notte, fora elli impedito 51 d’altrui, o non sarria ché non potesse?».
query.result: 49 "How is that?" was the reply. "If someone wanted 50 to climb at night, would he be prevented 51 by someone else, or would he be unable to do so?"

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
52 E ’l buon Sordello in terra fregò ’l dito, 53 dicendo: «Vedi? sola questa riga 54 non varcheresti dopo ’l sol partito:
55 non però ch’altra cosa desse briga, 56 che la notturna tenebra, ad ir suso; 57 quella col nonpoder la voglia intriga.
query.result:
52 And the good Sordello rubbed his finger on the ground, 53 saying: "See? You would not cross this line alone 54 after the sun has set:
55 not because anything else would cause trouble, 56 but the darkness of the night, to go up; 57 that, with its impossibility, entangles the will.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
58 Ben si poria con lei tornare in giuso 59 e passeggiar la costa intorno errando, 60 mentre che l’orizzonte il dì tien chiuso».
query.result: 58 One could indeed return down with it 59 and wander, pacing the hillside, 60 while the horizon keeps the day enclosed."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
61 Allora il mio segnor, quasi ammirando, 62 «Menane», disse, «dunque là ’ve dici 63 ch’aver si può diletto dimorando».
query.result: 61 Then my lord, as if in wonder, 62 said, "Lead us, then, to where you say 63 one can have pleasure while staying."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
64 Poco allungati c’eravam di lici, 65 quand’ io m’accorsi che ’l monte era scemo, 66 a guisa che i vallon li sceman quici.
query.result: 64 We had gone a short distance from there, 65 when I realized that the mountain was indented, 66 in the way that valleys indent them here.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
67 «Colà», disse quell’ ombra, «n’anderemo 68 dove la costa face di sé grembo; 69 e là il novo giorno attenderemo».

Please translate literally into English.
70 Tra erto e piano era un sentiero schembo, 71 che ne condusse in fianco de la lacca, 72 là dove più ch’a mezzo muore il lembo.
query.result: 70 Between steep and level was a winding path, 71 which led us to the side of the hollow, 72 where the slope dies away more than halfway up.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
73 Oro e argento fine, cocco e biacca, 74 indaco, legno lucido e sereno, 75 fresco smeraldo in l’ora che si fiacca,
76 da l’erba e da li fior, dentr’ a quel seno 77 posti, ciascun saria di color vinto, 78 come dal suo maggiore è vinto il meno.
query.result:
73 Fine gold and silver, scarlet and white lead, 74 indigo, polished and clear wood, 75 fresh emerald at the hour it is broken,
76 placed within that hollow by the grass and flowers, 77 each would be vanquished in color, 78 as the lesser is vanquished by its greater.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
79 Non avea pur natura ivi dipinto, 80 ma di soavità di mille odori 81 vi facea uno incognito e indistinto.
query.result: 79 Nature had not only painted there, 80 but with the sweetness of a thousand scents 81 she made there an unknown and indistinct one.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
82 ‘Salve, Regina’ in sul verde e ’n su’ fiori 83 quindi seder cantando anime vidi, 84 che per la valle non parean di fuori.
query.result: 82 ‘Salve, Regina’ on the green grass and on the flowers 83 I saw souls sitting and singing there, 84 who did not appear outside for the valley.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
85 «Prima che ’l poco sole omai s’annidi», 86 cominciò ’l Mantoan che ci avea vòlti, 87 «tra color non vogliate ch’io vi guidi.
query.result: 85 "Before the little sun now sets," 86 began the Mantuan who had turned us, 87 "do not want me to guide you among them.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
88 Di questo balzo meglio li atti e ’ volti 89 conoscerete voi di tutti quanti, 90 che ne la lama giù tra essi accolti.
query.result: 88 From this ledge you will recognize their actions and faces 89 better than from down below among them, 90 where they are gathered in the glen.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
91 Colui che più siede alto e fa sembianti 92 d’aver negletto ciò che far dovea, 93 e che non move bocca a li altrui canti,
94 Rodolfo imperador fu, che potea 95 sanar le piaghe c’hanno Italia morta, 96 sì che tardi per altri si ricrea.
query.result:
91 He who sits highest and appears 92 to have neglected what he should have done, 93 and who does not move his lips to the others' songs,
94 was Emperor Rudolf, who could have healed 95 the wounds that have killed Italy, 96 so that it is too late for it to be revived by others.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
97 L’altro che ne la vista lui conforta, 98 resse la terra dove l’acqua nasce 99 che Molta in Albia, e Albia in mar ne porta:
100 Ottacchero ebbe nome, e ne le fasce 101 fu meglio assai che Vincislao suo figlio 102 barbuto, cui lussuria e ozio pasce.
query.result:
97 The other who comforts him with his gaze, 98 ruled the land where the water is born 99 that the Moldau carries into the Elbe, and the Elbe into the sea:
100 his name was Ottokar, and in his swaddling clothes 101 he was much better than his son Wenceslas, 102 the bearded one, whom luxury and idleness feed.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
103 E quel nasetto che stretto a consiglio 104 par con colui c’ha sì benigno aspetto, 105 morì fuggendo e disfiorando il giglio:
106 guardate là come si batte il petto! 107 L’altro vedete c’ha fatto a la guancia 108 de la sua palma, sospirando, letto.
query.result:
103 And that little nose who seems to be in close counsel 104 with the one who has such a benign appearance, 105 died fleeing and deflowering the lily:
106 look there how he beats his breast! 107 See the other who has made a bed of his palm for his cheek, 108 sighing.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
109 Padre e suocero son del mal di Francia: 110 sanno la vita sua viziata e lorda, 111 e quindi viene il duol che sì li lancia.
query.result: 109 They are the father and father-in-law of the evil of France: 110 they know his corrupt and filthy life, 111 and from that comes the grief that so pierces them.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
121 Rade volte risurge per li rami 122 l’umana probitate; e questo vole 123 quei che la dà, perché da lui si chiami.

Please translate literally into English.
124 Anche al nasuto vanno mie parole 125 non men ch’a l’altro, Pier, che con lui canta, 126 onde Puglia e Proenza già si dole.
query.result: 124 My words go to the snub-nosed one 125 no less than to the other, Peter, who sings with him, 126 for whom Apulia and Provence now grieve.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
127 Tant’ è del seme suo minor la pianta, 128 quanto, più che Beatrice e Margherita, 129 Costanza di marito ancor si vanta.
query.result: 127 So much less is the plant of his seed, 128 as Constance still boasts of her husband, 129 more than Beatrice and Margaret.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
130 Vedete il re de la semplice vita 131 seder là solo, Arrigo d’Inghilterra: 132 questi ha ne’ rami suoi migliore uscita.
query.result: 130 See the king of the simple life 131 sitting there alone, Henry of England: 132 he has a better outcome in his branches.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
133 Quel che più basso tra costor s’atterra, 134 guardando in suso, è Guiglielmo marchese, 135 per cui e Alessandria e la sua guerra
136 fa pianger Monferrato e Canavese».
query.result:
133 He who bows down lowest among them, 134 looking up, is Marquis William, 135 because of whom Alessandria and its war
136 make Monferrato and Canavese weep."
